intro: Tetracera asiatica subsp. sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran tetracera, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in lowland and hill forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
